definition[0]: an important or exciting news story that is printed in one newspaper or shown on one television station before any of the others know about it
example[0]: a journalist looking for a scoop
definition[1]: a round deep spoon for serving food, for example ice cream or mashed potato
definition[2]: an amount of food served with a scoop
note[1]: whatâ€™s the scoop? (=used to ask for information or news)
example[2]: the inside scoop  (=special information that other people do not have) on the markets
definition[4]: to pick something up or remove it using a scoop or a spoon, or your curved hand
example[3]: She bent down and scooped up the little dog.
example[4]: Cut the tomato in half and scoop out the seeds with a teaspoon.
definition[5]: to be the first newspaper to print an important news report
example[5]: Time and again, we have scooped our rivals.
definition[6]: to win a prize or award
example[6]: Britain scooped the top prize in the over-50s category.
